comments:
Build id: 200704261031

Steps: Create a Dynamic Web Project with Dynamic Web Module 2.5 and JSF 1.2 facets.

Failed while installing JavaServer Faces 1.2.
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallDelegate.resolveConfigPath(JSFFacetInstallDelegate.java:252)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallDelegate.createConfigFile(JSFFacetInstallDelegate.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.core.internal.project.facet.JSFFacetInstallDelegate.execute(JSFFacetInstallDelegate.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.callDelegate(FacetedProject.java:1224)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.modifyInternal(FacetedProject.java:415)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.access$2(FacetedProject.java:288)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject$1.run(FacetedProject.java:270)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetedProject.modify(FacetedProject.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.ui.ModifyFacetedProjectWizard.performFinish(ModifyFacetedProjectWizard.java:373)
	at org.eclipse.wst.web.ui.internal.wizards.NewProjectDataModelFacetWizard.performFinish(NewProjectDataModelFacetWizard.java:293)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.ui.ModifyFacetedProjectWizard$2.run(ModifyFacetedProjectWizard.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.ui.ModifyFacetedProjectWizard$3.run(ModifyFacetedProjectWizard.java:275)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Issues:

- should be checking for null when querying WebArtifactEdit.
- should we be checking that the webapp exists and failing to install facet if not present? (throw CoreException)?

Yes, we could/should be checking for null webArtifactEdit.   However, this error is occurring during JSF facet installation which has requirements of having a valid web app.   It is perfectly reasonable to assume that the web app is valid, and that there is a valid WebArtifactEdit to get.
Moving the bug to jee component

(In reply to comment #2)
> Yes, we could/should be checking for null webArtifactEdit.   However, this
> error is occurring during JSF facet installation which has requirements of
> having a valid web app.   It is perfectly reasonable to assume that the web app
> is valid, and that there is a valid WebArtifactEdit to get.  
> 

Request the Java EE team to review the bug. This is a show-stopper for supporting JSF 1.2.

Related bug? 
Run on Server a JSP  fails on web 2.5 modules : JSFFileURL should not refer to WebArtifactEdit for JEE Web 2.5 modules : classcastexception
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=182012

Now that we know that we must use the new IModelProvider code when dealing with 2.5 web modules, the ball is on our court to fix this bug.

It may be inappropriate to ask in this bug but, Carl, when should we expect the Web25ModelProvider to be fully implemented?  Is there a tracking bug that we can monitor?
Is this going to block the JSF smoke test this week?  Is it causing the JSF JUnit failures?  Any outlook when it will be fixed?

This will not block smoke testing as we are not testing JSF 1.2 with 2.5 web modules during smoke test.  The currently failing JUnits also do not have anything to do with this bug.

There are several bugs that we need to deal with with regards to 2.5 web modules that will eventually be checked in as a unit.   We cannot do that unil we can create a JSF 1.2 application which requires us to be able to update a 2.5 web model. As far as when this will be fixed depends on when J2EE completes it's work on the IModelProvider.    Whatever bug that is tracking the j2ee work should be marked a blocker.  I am going to reduce the severity of this bug from blocking to normal.

> As far as when this will be fixed depends on when J2EE completes
> it's work on the IModelProvider.    Whatever bug that is tracking the j2ee work
> should be marked a blocker.
John,
Are you aware of a defect that is tracking the 'fix' to the IModelProvider?
-Raghu
Jason, Chuck, can you answer Raghu's question?  Is this work in for RC0?
For 2.5 web projects, this is not yet in.  We anticipate it will go in for next week's I-Build.
*** Bug 186571 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
